banner_backend_help.date_range_table:
Date Range Table Help

This is the table of date ranges.
     The client, campaign and banner fields are simply information for you to use to keep track of your banners and are not loaded into the Flash modules.
     The start date and end date fields represent the actual data that will be loaded into the banner.
     The ID is the key for this date set and will be placed into the actionscript of the banner to load the start date and end date information. Give this ID value to your developer to enter into their code. Nothing else should be needed.
     The Select button is for your convenience in case you wish to create a second date set or custom field for the same banner. All it does it enter the client, campaign and banner information into the form entry fields below so you don't need to retype them.
     The Delete button will delete this entry entirely from the database, which you should only do once the banner has been discontinued or if you are sure the date range is not being used.
     The Update button will load the table row information into the date range form field below and change the functionality of the form so that it updates this row of data instead of adding a new entry.
banner_backend_help.custom_field_table:
Custom Field Table Help

This is the table of custom fields, used for any specialized or miscellaneous data that needs to be loaded into a banner.
     The client, campaign and banner fields are simply information for you to use to keep track of your banners and are not loaded into the Flash modules. The field name and field value fields represent the actual data that will be loaded into the banner. The ID is the key for this custom field and will be placed into the actionscript of the banner to load the custom field. Give this ID value to your developer to enter into their code. They may also need the field name.
     The Select button is for your convenience in case you wish to create a second date set or custom field for the same banner. All it does it enter the client, campaign and banner information into the form entry fields below so you don't need to retype them.
     The Delete button will delete this entry entirely from the database, which you should only do once the banner has been discontinued or if you are sure the custom field is not being used.
     The Update button will load the table row information into the custom field form below and change the functionality of the form so that it updates this row of data instead of adding a new entry.
banner_backend_help.date_range_form:
Date Range Form Help

The new date range form is where you enter new date ranges or update existing ones.
     You may enter whatever you want in the client, campaign and banner fields to help you remember which banner is which. However, you might not want to enter the real client name if they have not authorized us to put their information on Google App Engine.
     To enter a start date and end date, simply click in the field and a date-picker component will pop up. Simply choose your date and it will automatically be entered into the field. Click submit when finished and your new date range will be added to the database and the table above.
     To update a date range, click the Update button next to the proper entry in the date range table above then enter your information and click submit. To cancel an update or clear the form fields, click the clear button next to the submit button.
banner_backend_help.custom_field_form:
Custom Field Form Help

The new custom field form is where you enter new custom fields or update existing ones.
     You may enter whatever you want in the client, campaign and banner fields to help you remember which banner is which. However, you might not want to enter the real client name if they have not authorized us to put their information on Google App Engine. Make certain the field name you enter contains only letters, numbers and underscores, and does not begin with a number, since it will be referred to as a variable in the banner code. Click submit when finished and your new custom field will be added to the database and the table above.
     To update a custom field, click the Update button next to the proper entry in the custom field table above then enter your information and click submit. To cancel an update or clear the form fields, click the clear button next to the submit button.
